intro: Allocarya filicaulis, commonly known as the featherleaf dandelion, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant has basal leaves that are elongated and feather-like, giving it its common name. It produces small, yellow flowers that develop into fluffy seed heads, typical of the genus Taraxacum. Allocarya filicaulis is often found in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and disturbed soils.
